The full protocol is available as an attachment.  The following is a summary that is also found in the attached full protocol.





Part 1:

body: Baseline assessments are taken the evening before dosing
Subjects are given study medication after an overnight fast and 2 hours before their first meal.
Part 1 includes 4 dose cohorts:  cohorts 1 and 2 consist of 4 subjects each, whereas Cohorts 3 and 4 will consist of 8 subjects each.
Subjects are randomized at a 3 \(active) to 1 \(placebo) ratio.
Each subject receives a single dose of either 0.1 mg/kg \(Cohort 1), 0.5 mg/kg \(Cohort 2), 3 mg/kg \(Cohort
of tildrakizumab IV administered over 1 hour; a minimum of 48 hours will elapse between drug administration to subjects.
After an 8-week safety observation period, each subject in Part 1 \(Cohorts 1 through
receives an additional two doses of tildrakizumab IV at 0.1, 0.5, 3, and 10 mg/kg, respectively, 4 weeks apart.
On Day 2, safety assessments are performed and PK samples obtained.

Subjects have a closeout visit within 14 days of the last safety and PK assessment.








Part 2

body.body: Up to 40 subjects with psoriasis are enrolled in Part 2
Subjects are put into 2 dose cohorts \(Cohorts 5 and 6).
Subjects in Cohort 5 receive 3 doses of 3 mg/kg tildrakizumab IV given at Week 0, 4, and
Subjects in Cohort 6 receive 3 doses of 10 mg/kg tildrakizumab IV given at Week 0, 4, and
Subjects are randomized in a 3:1 ratio of active to placebo.
Serum pharmacokinetic samples are obtained predose and at the intervals specified in the attached full protocol
Subjects receive Dose 2 and 3 of tildrakizumab during their visits on Days 28 and
Subjects have a closeout visit within 14 days of the last PK assessment.

A closeout visit will be scheduled within 14 days of the last PK assessment. 
  


Skin biopsy, pharmacokinetic, and safety details are provided in the attached full protocol
